website_summaries.verdict: This model boasts download speeds and range that rival TP-Link's higher-end models, without some of the extras that the average family does not use.
pros: Great router for users who want to extend their internet signal to every device in the home
AP mode allows for even faster WiFi
Allows you to set up a personal VPN server
cons: A shorter power cord than some models may put limitations on where this router can be placed

customer_reviews.title: Home Run!
customer_reviews.text: 27 years in the PC field and along comes this router, by far the best I have seen for coverage and speed. I pay Spectrum for 200/5 speed, this router gives me 238/12 all day long. The WiFi coverage is awesome, I had two routers originally but don't need the second one now. The setup was less that 10 minutes with my custom settings. I would recommend this product, and all the rest of the TP-Link product I own. Grade A+++++.
customer_reviews.author: Ben E. Norman

customer_reviews.title: 5g died after 2 months. Cannot be returned.
customer_reviews.text: The 5g band stopped broadcasting after 2 months. After wasting several hours over several days with TP-Link technical support, they were not able to resolve the issue or issue a replacement product! Buyer beware, you will not have a warranty if any company besides Amazon (or TP-Link) fulfills the order. While I can't recommend this product because of the aforementioned quality and warranty issues, the functioning parts of the router are exemplary. Setting up this router was incredibly intuitive and easy; I should know considering how much troubleshooting I've done. The working 2.4g band is blazing fast and stable as well, with nice coverage throughout my home (through 2-3 sheetrock walls) and up to ~100 ft into my yard.
customer_reviews.author: DMH

customer_reviews.title: 5GHz channel failed
customer_reviews.text: I bought it as used condition. Every time I turn on MU-MIMO function on the router, the 5GHz signal becomes totally unavailable. It may appear on the available WiFi list, but my laptop or iPhone cannot connect to it. Everything is fine when I disable the MU-MIMO function. A few weeks later, the 5G channel completely quit working, refusing to connect to new devices, and not allowing any data passing through. I restarted numerous times, but the problem exists. Eventually I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Navigator_Z

customer_reviews.title: Works great doubled my WiFi coverage compared to what Comcast charged rental fees for
customer_reviews.text: The one thing that I had trouble with was when I hooked it up I had it fed from a switch and had my modem output hooked to the same switch. That is all wrong as a call to their great tech support told me. You have to hook the output of your cable modem directly to the input of your router then hookup the router output to your switch. Do this and all is well. I had two separate Comcast techs come out to seen what was going on and they both couldn’t figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Kibbler

customer_reviews.title: It worked for less than a day
customer_reviews.text: I usually don't mind refurbished electronics. But in this case, buying refurbished was a bad Idea. I thought the refurbished AC2300 was a good price. It worked well at first and the WIFI covered the distance that needed it to. But 10 hours after hooking it up, the WIFI only worked intermittently; even with WIFI devices about 15 feet away. Then after a while, there was no signal at all. I returned the router.
customer_reviews.author: Joe °

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had nothing but problems with this router since new out of the box. Constantly drops out and has to be reset to defaults and the config reloaded. Seems to fix the issue for a while then it drops connections again. Cannot recommend this product. I’ve also had similar issues with other TPLink routers. Customer support is lacking to the point I simply throw the nonworking items in the dumpster. This will be the last TPLink item I purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Barter

customer_reviews.title: Solid router with good range.
customer_reviews.text: I replaced 2 routers with the one AC2300 and I still get good coverage throughout the house. Also, I really like the external wireless-enable-disable button: makes it easy and quick to turn off wireless when we go on vacation. One inconvenience: when I upgraded the router to the latest firmware, it warns you that it will reset your router to factory configuration. No big deal: be sure to update first before you customize.
customer_reviews.author: W. Kim

customer_reviews.title: FAST, EASY and QUICK to Set-up!
customer_reviews.text: Wow is all I can say a the moment. I have purchased and tried several WiFi routers since my Apple Airport began to go down the tubes. All previous purchases have been blah and returned! Either too slow, too clunky or just didn't work. And then I purchased this beauty! Simple, easy, fast and no complaints. The biggest win is the TP-Link Tether App...I came home from lunch, downloaded the APP and had the new router up and running within minutes...REALLY! Love the router, love the APP!
customer_reviews.author: Pepper

customer_reviews.title: TP-Link Archer A2300  - Good speed, great price but not the quickest to set up
customer_reviews.text: Faster and more stable than my old Archer C7. But setup took much longer than my past experiences with C5 & C7. Tether app could not detect the router after connection, I ended up using web access through wi-fi coonection. This model is sold for much less than the identical router Archer C2300.
customer_reviews.author: M. Y.

customer_reviews.title: Great Speed and Range
customer_reviews.text: After many years, it was time to replace our wireless router. I had just helped my dad find the best solution for his needs, and decided that it might also fit our needs both now and for the foreseeable future. In both cases, my dad’s and ours, the need was for a newer router that provided more range and speed capabilities. This router does not seem to have any dead spots in either house, and easily accommodates Spectrum internet speeds on multiple devices at the same time. If you’re in the market for a new router like we were, this is a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: Allen

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: Strong signal upstairs and down only slight deterioration in the back rooms. With multiple bands can run TV and all the other electronics at once with no buffering. Also with the USB 3 have a 5 terabyte hard drive with instant access for movies, music and photos which eliminates the need for a larger hard drive in my laptop. I am sold on the TP-LINK AC2300
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: It is powerful and very stable. Does the job well, but the interface is not all that great and does not give you lots of flexibility. For example, you cannot assign friendly names to devices so you can tell what is connected easily. I had an ASUS (3200) which has a great interface, but the 2.4GHz in it was unreliable so I switched to this router.
customer_reviews.author: Michael St Denis

customer_reviews.title: Firmware upgrade broke it
customer_reviews.text: After installing the firmware upgrade the 5G network became disabled "due to region restrictions." And the 2G network could not be found. Still did not work after resetting to factory defaults. Read reviews, and apparently this is a common problem and they reported TP-Link tech support not able to resolve after lengthy efforts. Decided not to take chances and just returned it. Too bad, I was hoping the price friendly router was the answer, but I think I will stay away from TP-Link.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Junk. Loses connection every few minutes.
customer_reviews.text: It took forever to get it to connect at setup. Had to call customer service. Took them am hour to get it to connect. It still drops connection every few minutes. It will reconnect a few seconds later, but then drop connecting again after a few minutes. I finally gave up and reconnected my old router. At least I can watch TV again. This was a complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Ray

customer_reviews.title: Beware of false sellers!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve done enough research to find that this is one of the best router that’s available for the buck! However I made a wrong choice in selecting the seller. Please don’t get this from “24-7 store”. I has signal drop problems and the router restarted for no reason often! I’ve returned the product and got the same model from BB (paid a little extra) and it works the best!!! It’s handling so much load than I expected it!
customer_reviews.author: Another Amazon shopper

customer_reviews.title: Buy this! Pair it with an arris surfboard and you'll thank me later!
customer_reviews.text: Doubled my speed and now my WiFi on my galaxy s8 tests an 995 mbps average. I use many devices without any lag or any ping fluctuations.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine for almost a year, tech/warranty support is a joke
customer_reviews.text: No issues for about 10 months. Solid range and no complains. Then it stopped getting signal. Tried several Ethernet cords, called internet provider to make sure it was not an issue with service. Called tp link tech support and was told it wouldn’t be covered even without power outages and using a surge protector. So I’m under a year it died and I was told sorry about my luck. I understand products fail but after talking with their tech support, I highly recommend another brand.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and fast WiFi router
customer_reviews.text: Functions flawlessly. Some issues with loosing connection when first installed. After installing latest firmware all is good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seems good!
customer_reviews.text: So far, this seems to be an amazing router for the price. It looks sleek, the web interface is nice, and performance has been good. You can also turn off the status LEDs which is a great feature for me.

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted it to be fast, but it's not even 1200
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice router and faster than the Linksys WRT AC1200 I have, but it only hits about AC500 tops. My cheap Asus ac1200s router easily hits 120. I've tested it in various conditions with similar results. I think it needs a longer antenna.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great range and performance
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an Asus RT-AC68U router that failed after four years of use with this one. The TP Link has much better range and performance than the Asus router. I couldn't believe the difference. I can speak to the durability of the TP link but so far i'm impressed with what I've experienced.
customer_reviews.author: Sammich

customer_reviews.title: Wow! Highly impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my parents and bought me the Netgear (R7800-100NAS) Nighthawk. Man, wish I would have given them the Nighthawk as this thing runs circles around the Nighthawk. Extremely easy to setup right out of the box......did I mention, fast and reliable......
customer_reviews.author: Always a Sooner4life

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy horrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: This product is horrible and when you try and get support they hang up on you. I am going over a week with no replacement. I would never buy this product again!!!!
customer_reviews.author: trent

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up and high speed.
customer_reviews.text: This router was easy to set up and get all our devices, including Roku boxes, synced up to it. We noticed an immediate improvement on speed and have not had any glitching while streaming.
customer_reviews.author: dalymagnuson

customer_reviews.title: Great Range, Easy Setup
customer_reviews.text: I was able to remove the wife extender in my house after installing this router as the AC2300 had enough range to reach all the devices in my 2 story house. The iPhone app was easy to use for router setup.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: The TP-Link AC2300 is easy to install, clear directions and boosts your signal very far!
customer_reviews.text: The router works really great especially if you are trying to hook up a couple of cottages to get Wi-Fi. Emails work the best. This is the second one we've purchased (we manage cottage rentals on Lake Huron). Its very hard to get a signal and this router works better than anything we've purchased in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Ann

customer_reviews.title: Much better the netgear product!!!
customer_reviews.text: In the past 10 years, I've been use NetGear routers and the experience was SUCK! (constantly having no internet connection, extreme low internet speed, and etc). After switching TP-Link, I am getting no problem with my Internet at all for past 4 months. It's super stable and the range is even better than my previous owned Netgear NightHawk X6.
customer_reviews.author: frorstzyh

customer_reviews.title: Issues with 5GHz band.
customer_reviews.text: The 5GHz band on the AC2300 model stopped working after a few days. Would not recommend this particular TP-Link router model.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It pretty much covers our whole house which is one and a half story which is good coverage.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Great router, it definitely has a stronger signal than my previous which was a $100 linksys.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Childers

customer_reviews.title: Get the warranty, you are going to need it!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for roughly a month and afterwards began to have sputtering wifi. Then one day it just died. Turns on but ona constant reboot, with a settled state that is unable to produce a wifi network or reconize ther input.
customer_reviews.author: Cody

customer_reviews.title: Great router!
customer_reviews.text: We got this to replace our Archer C9. Works great! We have a very long house and it covers everywhere. Very easy to setup!
customer_reviews.author: JWebb

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great range, easy to set up great price and a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Nashcbrguy

customer_reviews.title: Died exactly one year later
customer_reviews.text: I expected this router to last longer. My ASUS has been going on 4 years and this TP Link ease used as an access point. How disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Azroadhog

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup! Stable connections via wired or wireless.
customer_reviews.text: Super easy setup!! Getting 120Mbps on my iPhone. (Not even with a full signal.) Same 120Mbps on all my wired connections. Wife is happy.......all that matters.
customer_reviews.author: JosephN

customer_reviews.title: On time delivery
customer_reviews.text: I have the unit installed and haven't had a problem yet. Has lowered my buffering and stalls.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Works okay...not as powerful as i had hoped used it one day and ordered a Linksys router which wasnt much better
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Instructions provided in packaging, and a different set of ...
customer_reviews.text: Instructions provided in packaging, and a different set of instructions online, did not produce the desired results. However phone support walked me step by step through a completely different set of instructions to achieve what I wanted from the router and it has been performing as expected since.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce D. Jaben

customer_reviews.title: Nothing to brag about
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to extend the range to a new sunroom. Was disappointed. Not any better than my Netgear R6300 that I replaced.
customer_reviews.author: T. Sorensen

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: It has a great power, but has problems to access main page through web
customer_reviews.author: Conrado Frau

customer_reviews.title: GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: I had very bad coverage and with this i have more than enough. SUPER EASY installation. Recommend 110%!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rafael C

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I like having the app for conveinince. So far so good
customer_reviews.author: komputer_puter

customer_reviews.title: It would be sufficient if it worked.
customer_reviews.text: My device worked out of the box and slowly decayed. It began to limit my bandwidth and eventually began to reset every moment it seemed to finish booting. TPLINK support is your go to for stereotypically bad Indian phone and chat support.
customer_reviews.author: CAROL MCCARTHY

customer_reviews.title: Box had appeared as though it had been opened before we received it.
customer_reviews.text: Showed a WiFi sign was there but not transmitting one.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Keune

customer_reviews.title: Does it's job
customer_reviews.text: Router works for my medium sized home. The 2.4 band gave out all of the sudden however tech support from tp link helped me solve it on the spot
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: Wifi coverage its pretry good, nice technology on this router you can use ...
customer_reviews.text: Wifi coverage its pretry good, nice technology on this router you can use it a an access point in one click.
customer_reviews.author: Willy

customer_reviews.title: Will not stay connected to HP printers
customer_reviews.text: Continually loses contact with both HP printers. I have wasted way too much time trying to get it to connect and print. Sometimes works, most times does not. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: cew CA

customer_reviews.title: very strong signal in my home
customer_reviews.text: nice design, easy to see device lights & strong signal to all parts of my house
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazingly fast
customer_reviews.text: Completely exceeded all expectations. Couldn't have asked for more. Great signal from both 2.4 and 5 Ghz throughout my entire house. Absolutely satisfied with this purchase!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Speed
customer_reviews.text: Much faster than what I had and easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Router
customer_reviews.text: Received prompt service. Easy to hook up and worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas A. Ludka

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for three months
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for three months, then stopped. I am giving it three stars because I was still able to get the unit replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a few hours before failing...
customer_reviews.text: This router was initially easy to set up using the instructions and tether app but then after a couple of hours the 5 GHz band stopped working. Then, the 2.4GHz stopped working overnight. The only response would be that the Power indicator led would flash and attempt to reboot continuously. I did a factory reset but that has not done anything to fix the issue. I am waiting for a replacement and sending this one back hoping the replacement will work like it is supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: BC38915170

customer_reviews.title: Questionable
customer_reviews.text: I get better WiFi coverage than my old router (an AC1200), but I question the reliability. I have totally lost connectivity, both wired and wireless, twice in the first 6 weeks of service. Rebooting and quick power cycling didn't help. I had to unplug the router for several minutes to regain a connection. At twice the price of my old router, I expected much better! EDIT: After the 4th failure in 7 weeks of owning this router, right as the Canadian Gran Prix was starting, I decided I had had enough! Thanks to Amazon's amazing customer service, I am returning this defective product ans shopping for a new modem. I now hate this modem: 1 star!
customer_reviews.author: Jimi

customer_reviews.title: Just an average router with average wireless coverage
customer_reviews.text: Being generous with the 3 stars. One drawback is the power cord is about 1.5 feet shorter than the other routers i have had in the past. Bought it from user ratings and the people pleased with the coverage. Coverage isnt any better than my 7 yesr old Netgear. Would have gone with the Netgear, but i had 2 go belly up with firmware upgrades in less than a week. I am also pretty sure the “new” Netgear i purchased wasnt really new. Will keep it even though for the coverage it is way over priced.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky

customer_reviews.title: likely product or firmware defect
customer_reviews.text: From the other reviews, this product appears to have a defect: Similar to others, for me, easy setup, screaming fast, yet within 3 days, the wifi simply disappeared. At the same time, the app and unit suggests wifi is operating. Despite hours of effort from this experienced techy, wifi could not be recovered. Will try one additional replacement unit.
customer_reviews.author: DevelopmentDoc

product_meta.title: TP-Link AC2300 Wireless WiFi Router | Powerful 1.8GHz Dual-Core 64-Bit CPU | RangeBoost Technology | Wave 2 MU-MIMO (Archer A2300)
product_meta.description:
The Archer A2300 sends more bandwidth and creates faster connections for 4K streaming and gaming. Wave 2 AC2300 Wi-
Fi delivers up to 2225Mbps over dual 2.4 GHz (600 Mbps) and 5 GHz (1625 Mbps) bands.
Wave 2 AC2300 provides up to 204% more throughput than AC750 routers, letting you game at the highest settings while 
streaming content on multiple devices without slowing down your Wi-Fi.

TP-Link received the highest numerical score among 6 companies in the J.D. Power 2017 U.S. Wireless Router Satisfaction Report, based on 980 total responses, measuring the opinions of customers who purchased a wireless router in the previous 12 months, surveyed October 2017. Your experiences may vary. Visit jdpower.com Frequency Range: 2.4GHz and 5GHz; Interface Available: 4 x 10/100/1000Mbps LAN Ports , 1 10/100/1000Mbps WAN Port, 1 USB 3.0 Port + 1 USB 2.0 Port; Protocols Supported: Supports IPv4 and IPv6; System Requirement: Microsoft Windows 98SE NT 2000 XP Vista, or Windows 7 8 8.1 10 MAC OS NetWare UNIX or Linux, Internet Explorer 11 Firefox 12.0 Chrome 20.0 Safari 4.0 or other Java-enabled browser, Cable or DSL Modem, Subscription with an Internet Service Provider (for Internet access); Wireless Standards: IEEE 802.11ac/n/a 5GHz, IEEE 802.11b/g/n 2.4GHz
feature_bullets: POWERFUL 1.8 GigaHertz DUAL CORE PROCESSOR : Leading-Edge 1.8 GigaHertz dualcore 64vbit CPU with 2 co processors and XStream processing architecture for smoother performance and powerful multi tasking
FASTER WIFI : Enjoy 4K video and play online games simultaneously with ultra fast 802.11ac Wave 2 MUMIMO WiFi
VPN SERVER : Set up a personal VPN server with an OpenVPN client to browse the web and access files without paid VPN subscriptions

FAR REACHING WIFI : RangeBoost amplifies the router's ability to detect and receive WiFi signal from devices located farther away; Beamforming locates WiFi devices and focuses the router's wireless signal toward them
EFFICIENT WIFI DISTRIBUTION : Airtime Fairness equally divides attention between newer and older devices to improve WiFi performance and reliability without limiting your network
LINK AGGREGATION : Team up two of the four Gigabit LAN ports to double connection speeds from 1 Gbps to 2 Gbps
LEADING SUPPORT : Industry leading 2 year warranty and unlimited 24/7 technical support
ENJOY AP MODE : Switch the router to AP mode and enjoy faster WiFi without replacing your router or ISP required Gateway

specifications.Operating System: Windows 98SE, NT, 2000, XP, Vista or Windows 7, 8, 8.1, 10, MAC OS, NetWare, UNIX or Linux
specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars141 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
